did.unittitle: Patrick Snadon collection on Kentucky historic houses
did.abstract: The Patrick Snadon collection on Kentucky historic houses (dated undated; 0.13 cubic feet; 1 box and 1 folder) comprises photographs of the Bronston House in Richmond, Kentucky, built by Matthew Kennedy, and an unknown Victorian house in Louisville, Kentucky.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Architectural historian, Patrick Snadon is an associate professor emeritus in the School of Architecture and Interior Design at the University of Cincinnati. He was a consultant on the restoration of historic buildings built by Benjamin Latrobe (Decatur House in Washington, D.C. for the National Trust for Historic Preservation and the Pope Villa in Lexington, KY for the Blue Grass Trust for Historic Preservation).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Patrick Snadon collection on Kentucky historic houses (dated undated; 0.13 cubic feet; 1 box and 1 folder) comprises photographs of the Bronston House in Richmond, Kentucky, built by Matthew Kennedy, and an unknown Victorian house in Louisville, Kentucky. The photographs of the Victorian house document the interior of the house. Additionally, the collection contains a genealogy of the Pope family, including information on Senator John Pope of the Pope Villa in Lexington, Kentucky.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Bronston House was designed by Matthew Kennedy, Kentucky's first architect.
